answers.answer: Yes..my feet started to look swollen
My midwife advised me of i get any sweling of the face, hands or feet to call her x
Its normal when u reach to the end my couzin got swelling on face big time n she is skiny nothing happen to her.
Drink lots of water will help

I think the problem is we are told so many different things from different medical professions! As my midwife says.. if your concerned there always there to help and reassure you :) ive always been told to phone if i get exsessive swelling ecspecially now being 34+ weeks to make someone aware :)
I would call your doctor. My midwives always say swelling in the hands or face to call them immediately.

It can be normal for swelling if the hands and feet but not so much of the face. I would call your doctor ASAP cause it can be a sign of preeclampsia, which is serious if not caught early. I'm going through the same thing right now, I'm almost 35 weeks and my doctor said if I got any swelling of the face or neck to call her right away.

I had swelling on my face a couple of weeks ago and I called the Dr's office and she said that maybe I wasn't drinking enough water and that my blood pressure could have been up but she  didn't like the sound of me swelling on my face or numbing of  face so she said to rest and get happen again I should just go straight to the labor& delivery so that would put a monitor on me and check what was going on
Please call your doctor or midwife ASAP. The type of swelling you are describing could be a sign of pre eclampsia.

question: Woke up this morning and my face is a little swollen, especially under my eyes it looks like I have bags under them n can barely keep them open.is it normal?
title: swelling at 35 weeks?!?!
